tree.name: uv
tree.description: An extremely fast Python package manager.

options.name: --no-cache
options.description: Avoid reading from or writing to the cache, instead using a temporary directory for the duration of the operation

options.name: --cache-dir
options.description: Path to the cache directory

options.name: --python-preference
options.description: Whether to prefer uv-managed or system Python installations

options.name: --allow-python-downloads
options.description: Allow automatically downloading Python when required. [env: "UV_PYTHON_DOWNLOADS=auto"]

options.name: --no-python-downloads
options.description: Disable automatic downloads of Python. [env: "UV_PYTHON_DOWNLOADS=never"]

options.name: --python-fetch
options.description: Deprecated version of [`Self::python_downloads`]

options.description: Do not print any output

options.description: Use verbose output

options.name: --no-color
options.description: Disable colors

options.name: --color
options.description: Control colors in output

options.description: Whether to load TLS certificates from the platform's native certificate store

options.name: --offline
options.description: Disable network access

options.name: --allow-insecure-host
options.description: Allow insecure connections to a host

options.name: --preview
options.description: Whether to enable experimental, preview features

options.name: --isolated
options.description: Avoid discovering a `pyproject.toml` or `uv.toml` file

options.name: --show-settings
options.description: Show the resolved settings for the current command

options.name: --no-progress
options.description: Hide all progress outputs

options.description: Skip writing `uv` installer metadata files (e.g., `INSTALLER`, `REQUESTED`, and `direct_url.json`) to site-packages `.dist-info` directories

options.name: --directory
options.description: Change to the given directory prior to running the command

options.name: --project
options.description: Run the command within the given project directory

options.name: --config-file
options.description: The path to a `uv.toml` file to use for configuration

options.name: --no-config
options.description: Avoid discovering configuration files (`pyproject.toml`, `uv.toml`)

options.name: --help
options.description: Display the concise help for this command

options.name: --version
options.description: Display the uv version

options.name: --extra
options.description: Include optional dependencies from the specified extra name

options.name: --all-extras
options.description: Include all optional dependencies

options.name: --no-extra
options.description: Exclude the specified optional dependencies, if `--all-extras` is supplied

options.name: --dev
options.description: Include the development dependency group

options.name: --no-dev
options.description: Omit the development dependency group

options.name: --group
options.description: Include dependencies from the specified dependency group

options.name: --no-group
options.description: Exclude dependencies from the specified dependency group

options.name: --only-group
options.description: Only include dependencies from the specified dependency group

options.name: --all-groups
options.description: Include dependencies from all dependency groups

options.name: --module
options.description: Run a Python module

options.name: --only-dev
options.description: Only include the development dependency group

options.name: --no-editable
options.description: Install any editable dependencies, including the project and any workspace members, as non-editable

options.name: --env-file
options.description: Load environment variables from a `.env` file

options.name: --no-env-file
options.description: Avoid reading environment variables from a `.env` file

options.name: --with
options.description: Run with the given packages installed

options.name: --with-editable
options.description: Run with the given packages installed as editables

options.name: --with-requirements
options.description: Run with all packages listed in the given `requirements.txt` files

options.name: --isolated
options.description: Run the command in an isolated virtual environment

options.name: --no-sync
options.description: Avoid syncing the virtual environment

options.name: --locked
options.description: Assert that the `uv.lock` will remain unchanged

options.name: --frozen
options.description: Run without updating the `uv.lock` file

options.name: --script
options.description: Run the given path as a Python script

options.name: --gui-script
options.description: Run the given path as a Python GUI script

options.name: --index
options.description: The URLs to use when resolving dependencies, in addition to the default index

options.name: --default-index
options.description: The URL of the default package index (by default: <https://pypi.org/simple>)

options.name: --index-url
options.description: (Deprecated: use `--default-index` instead) The URL of the Python package index (by default: <https://pypi.org/simple>)

options.name: --extra-index-url
options.description: (Deprecated: use `--index` instead) Extra URLs of package indexes to use, in addition to `--index-url`

options.name: --find-links
options.description: Locations to search for candidate distributions, in addition to those found in the registry indexes

options.name: --no-index
options.description: Ignore the registry index (e.g., PyPI), instead relying on direct URL dependencies and those provided via `--find-links`

options.name: --upgrade
options.description: Allow package upgrades, ignoring pinned versions in any existing output file. Implies `--refresh`

options.name: --upgrade-package
options.description: Allow upgrades for a specific package, ignoring pinned versions in any existing output file. Implies `--refresh-package`

options.name: --reinstall
options.description: Reinstall all packages, regardless of whether they're already installed. Implies `--refresh`

options.name: --reinstall-package
options.description: Reinstall a specific package, regardless of whether it's already installed. Implies `--refresh-package`

options.name: --index-strategy
options.description: The strategy to use when resolving against multiple index URLs

options.name: --keyring-provider
options.description: Attempt to use `keyring` for authentication for index URLs

options.name: --resolution
options.description: The strategy to use when selecting between the different compatible versions for a given package requirement

options.name: --prerelease
options.description: The strategy to use when considering pre-release versions

options.name: --fork-strategy
options.description: The strategy to use when selecting multiple versions of a given package across Python versions and platforms

options.name: --config-setting
options.description: Settings to pass to the PEP 517 build backend, specified as `KEY=VALUE` pairs

options.name: --no-build-isolation
options.description: Disable isolation when building source distributions

options.name: --no-build-isolation-package
options.description: Disable isolation when building source distributions for a specific package

options.name: --exclude-newer
options.description: Limit candidate packages to those that were uploaded prior to the given date

options.name: --link-mode
options.description: The method to use when installing packages from the global cache

options.description: Compile Python files to bytecode after installation

compile.name: compile
compile.description: Compile a `requirements.in` file to a `requirements.txt` file

options.name: --constraints
options.description: Constrain versions using the given requirements files

options.name: --overrides
options.description: Override versions using the given requirements files

options.name: --build-constraints
options.description: Constrain build dependencies using the given requirements files when building source distributions

options.name: --extra
options.description: Include optional dependencies from the specified extra name; may be provided more than once

options.name: --all-extras
options.description: Include all optional dependencies

options.name: --index
options.description: The URLs to use when resolving dependencies, in addition to the default index

options.name: --default-index
options.description: The URL of the default package index (by default: <https://pypi.org/simple>)

options.name: --index-url
options.description: (Deprecated: use `--default-index` instead) The URL of the Python package index (by default: <https://pypi.org/simple>)

options.name: --extra-index-url
options.description: (Deprecated: use `--index` instead) Extra URLs of package indexes to use, in addition to `--index-url`

options.name: --find-links
options.description: Locations to search for candidate distributions, in addition to those found in the registry indexes

options.name: --no-index
options.description: Ignore the registry index (e.g., PyPI), instead relying on direct URL dependencies and those provided via `--find-links`

options.name: --upgrade
options.description: Allow package upgrades, ignoring pinned versions in any existing output file. Implies `--refresh`

options.name: --upgrade-package
options.description: Allow upgrades for a specific package, ignoring pinned versions in any existing output file. Implies `--refresh-package`

options.name: --index-strategy
options.description: The strategy to use when resolving against multiple index URLs

options.name: --keyring-provider
options.description: Attempt to use `keyring` for authentication for index URLs

options.name: --resolution
options.description: The strategy to use when selecting between the different compatible versions for a given package requirement

options.name: --prerelease
options.description: The strategy to use when considering pre-release versions

options.name: --fork-strategy
options.description: The strategy to use when selecting multiple versions of a given package across Python versions and platforms

options.name: --config-setting
options.description: Settings to pass to the PEP 517 build backend, specified as `KEY=VALUE` pairs

options.name: --no-build-isolation
options.description: Disable isolation when building source distributions

options.name: --no-build-isolation-package
options.description: Disable isolation when building source distributions for a specific package

options.name: --exclude-newer
options.description: Limit candidate packages to those that were uploaded prior to the given date

options.name: --link-mode
options.description: The method to use when installing packages from the global cache

options.name: --no-sources
options.description: Ignore the `tool.uv.sources` table when resolving dependencies. Used to lock against the standards-compliant, publishable package metadata, as opposed to using any local or Git sources

options.name: --refresh
options.description: Refresh all cached data

options.name: --refresh-package
options.description: Refresh cached data for a specific package

options.name: --no-deps
options.description: Ignore package dependencies, instead only add those packages explicitly listed on the command line to the resulting the requirements file

options.name: --output-file
options.description: Write the compiled requirements to the given `requirements.txt` file

options.name: --no-strip-extras
options.description: Include extras in the output file

options.name: --no-strip-markers
options.description: Include environment markers in the output file

options.name: --no-annotate
options.description: Exclude comment annotations indicating the source of each package

options.name: --no-header
options.description: Exclude the comment header at the top of the generated output file

options.name: --annotation-style
options.description: The style of the annotation comments included in the output file, used to indicate the source of each package

options.name: --custom-compile-command
options.description: The header comment to include at the top of the output file generated by `uv pip compile`

options.name: --python
options.description: The Python interpreter to use during resolution.

options.name: --system
options.description: Install packages into the system Python environment

options.name: --generate-hashes
options.description: Include distribution hashes in the output file

options.name: --no-build
options.description: Don't build source distributions

options.name: --no-binary
options.description: Don't install pre-built wheels

options.name: --only-binary
options.description: Only use pre-built wheels; don't build source distributions

options.name: --python-version
options.description: The Python version to use for resolution

options.name: --python-platform
options.description: The platform for which requirements should be resolved

options.name: --universal
options.description: Perform a universal resolution, attempting to generate a single `requirements.txt` output file that is compatible with all operating systems, architectures, and Python implementations

options.name: --no-emit-package

options.description: Hide logs from the build backend

options.description: Constrain build dependencies using the given requirements files when building distributions

options.description: Require a matching hash for each requirement

options.description: Disable validation of hashes in the requirements file
